meanings.definition: A tax or duty imposed on goods.
meanings.sent1: The imposts on imported goods help the government collect money.
meanings.sent2: Businesses must pay imposts on items they bring into the country.
meanings.sent3: The imposts on chocolates made them seem like a luxury item.
meanings.sent4: The imposts on goods acted like a toll booth for the country's economy.
meanings.sent5: The imposts were like little price tags attached to each product.

meanings.definition: A block or stone placed on top of a column to support an arch.
meanings.sent1: The imposts were carefully carved to fit perfectly on the columns.
meanings.sent2: The ancient architects used imposts to create stunning arches.
meanings.sent3: The imposts on the columns looked like tiny hats for the stones.
meanings.sent4: The imposts stood proudly, holding the weight of the entire structure.
meanings.sent5: The imposts were like the strong shoulders carrying the weight of the arch.

meanings.definition: An overhanging part of a building.
meanings.sent1: The imposts provided shade for the windows below.
meanings.sent2: Birds often build nests on the imposts of tall buildings.
meanings.sent3: The imposts made the building look like it had a big hat on.
meanings.sent4: The imposts jutted out like protective arms around the structure.
meanings.sent5: The imposts were like the building's outstretched arms, welcoming visitors.
